comments.author: alexcrampton@hotmail.co.uk
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0E)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0E)

There is a little tiny bar that runs underneath the tabs itself. Clicking this bar whether you have one or many tabs opens, anywhere along the bar creates new blank tabs.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open Firefox
2.Open one or more tabs
3.Move mouse to the little Bar underneath the tabs.
4.Click Bar
Actual Results:  
More blank tabs are created

Expected Results:  
not do anything, this bar should be decorative purposes only (i presume) Using CTRL+T or the + button at the end of the tabbed browsing should be the only way to create new tabs.
